title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 December 2011 - XWiki
content:
01:49 <abusenius> has quit  
02:28 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
03:21 <lucaa> has quit  
04:50 <tuv> has joined #xwiki  
04:51 <tuv> can xwiki be installed on shared hosting?  
04:55 <@cjdelisle> if it's shared jvm hosting then it can but I recommend running it on it's own.  
04:57 <tuv> cjdelisle: i'm referring to standard shared web hosting services (dreamhost, hostgator, etc.) not sure about their jvm options  
04:58 <@sdumitriu> As long as they provide a Tomcat on which you can deploy a .war, it should work  
04:58 <@sdumitriu> (or another servlet container)  
05:02 <tuv> dreamhost and hostgator seem to \*not\* support server-side java :(  
05:02 <@cjdelisle> Yes indeed, if they allow redeployment it should be fine, my experince looking for shared java hosting was that it was expensive and lacking in features (compared to a VPS)  
05:35 <rrodriguez> has quit  
05:42 <tuv> has left #xwiki
